snippet: With no plans for American military intervention, the United States is frantically brokering peace talks between the warring factions while trying to fortify a United Nations peacekeeping force.
abstract: Obama administration, with no plans for a military intervention in war-torn South Sudan, is frantically brokering peace talks between factions while trying to fortify a United Nations peacekeeping force; country is in many ways a creation of the United States, which oversaw its inception and has nurtured its fragile institutions with billions in aid.

byline.contributor: Nicholas Kulish contributed reporting from Nairobi, Kenya.

lead_paragraph: With no plans for American military intervention, the United States is frantically brokering peace talks between the warring factions while trying to fortify a United Nations peacekeeping force.

headline.main: U.S. Is Facing Hard Choices in South Sudan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Facing Hard Choices In South Sudan

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
